content.description: Unknown 5.8 route with several bolts and some gear. I will update this route with more information from the FA or anyone else who knows.
content.protection: 3 bolts and some gear to a bolted anchor.
content.location: Third from left of the new bolted routes in this section.

content.description: Left trending route with some mixed gear among bolts. I will update this route with more information from the FA or anyone else who knows.
content.protection: 3 bolts and mixed gear. Shares an anchor with its neighbor to the left.
content.location: Second of four new bolted lines from the right near Mouse Hole Corner.

content.description:
This is a good route that starts on some very thins slab moves through several bolts. Eases significantly near the top.

I will update this route with more information from the FA or anyone else who knows.
content.protection: I think there were 7 bolts to a bolted anchor.
content.location: Leftmost of the 4 new bolted routes in this area.

content.description: Good route on new bolts. This is the right most of the 4 new bolted lines on the upper tier. Thin start through two horizontal seams/mini roof. Eases after the first two bolts. I will update this route with more information from the FA or anyone else who knows.
content.protection: 3 bolts if I recall correctly. some gear to sew it up. Fingers to hands sized. No anchor up top. There is a tree a ways back and crack to build an anchor.
content.location: The right most of the new bolted lines on the upper tier. 5 feet left of the Mouse Hole Corner. Look for shiny bolts.

content.description:
It climbs the obvious corner between the main slanted wall and the overhanging wall. The climb starts in the dirt large crack (the mouse hole) before getting in to the beautiful off-width that can be lay backed. Some jugs provide good rest, and a final easy hand crack brings you to the top.

Belay from the tree at the top.

Note: if there is a previous ascent send me info and I will fix it.
content.protection:
Double set of large cams (I used C4: 1x0.5, 1x 2, 2x 3, 2 x 4, and I would have liked a number 5.)

An anchor can be set up at the tree at the top (bring a cordalette).
content.location: In the corner between the main slanted wall and the overhanging wall. There is a tree at the base.

content.description:
Easy wide crack climbing up to a 2 bolt anchor.  (has rap ring and chains)  This would be a great first trad lead, as every stance is solid, and it takes a wide range of gear.  Falls not imminent.

If the first ascensionist has more information (and the correct name), please share.
content.protection: Cams of increasing size up to a 2 bolt anchor.  Anchor has a rap ring & chain.
content.location: From the first climb of Tiger Cage, go left up a gully and walk/scramble your way to this low angle wall.  Frisky is in the middle of the wall.
